title: King & Pawn: Key Squares
description: White must advance the king to a key square (d5, e5, or f5) to promote the pawn.
objective: Win by promoting the f-pawn. Use key squares to escort it.

title: Opposition Fundamentals
description: White must use opposition to push the pawn. Direct king opposition is the key.
objective: Win by gaining the opposition and promoting the pawn.

title: King Ahead of Pawn
description: King is already on a key square — this should be a straightforward win.
objective: Promote the f-pawn. The king is ideally placed ahead of it.

title: Distant Opposition
description: White can win by approaching with the right tempo to seize opposition.
objective: Win using distant opposition. Advance the king correctly.

title: Pawn on the 5th Rank
description: King on the 6th rank, pawn on 5th — this is a won position for White.
objective: Promote the e-pawn. King is already on its ideal square.

title: Stalemate Defense: Rook Pawn
description: Black has a rook pawn but White can draw with correct defense — stalemate trap in the corner.
objective: Draw by reaching the a1 corner. When the pawn reaches a2, White is stalemated.

title: Defending with Opposition
description: White defends a lost-looking position by keeping opposition on the pawn's file.
objective: Draw by maintaining opposition directly in front of the pawn.

title: Critical Position — e-pawn
description: A fundamental K+P vs K position. White to play — can White win?
objective: Win by gaining opposition. The key is to step to the side first.

title: Two Connected Pawns Win
description: Two connected pawns on the 6th rank with king support. One will promote.
objective: Promote one of the pawns. Advance the correct one first.

title: Winning with g-pawn
description: Standard K+P vs K with g-pawn. White must navigate to key squares.
objective: Promote the g-pawn by advancing the king to key squares first.

title: Avoid Stalemate!
description: White must be careful not to stalemate Black while promoting.
objective: Win without stalemating. Find the right king move.

title: Lucena Position
description: The most important rook endgame position. White wins with the 'bridge' technique.
objective: Win using the Lucena bridge-building method to shelter the king from checks.

title: Philidor Defense
description: Black can draw with the Philidor position — rook on the 3rd rank, then checking from behind.
objective: Draw using the Philidor technique. Keep the rook on the 6th rank cutting off the king.

title: Rook + Pawn vs Rook: Cutting Off the King
description: White's rook cuts off Black's king while the pawn advances.
objective: Win by keeping the enemy king cut off from the pawn.

title: Active Rook Principle
description: Rook activity trumps material. White's active rook vs Black's passive one.
objective: Use the active rook to win Black's pawn or create threats.

title: Rook vs Pawn — Frontal Attack
description: Rook in front of the pawn is usually a draw or win, depending on king position.
objective: Stop the pawn from promoting using frontal defense.

title: Rook vs Pawn — Side Approach
description: Rook must stop the advanced pawn. Correct technique is to approach from the side.
objective: Stop the d2-pawn from promoting using the rook.

title: Rook vs Rook: Cutting Off
description: Use the rook to cut off the enemy king from returning to the center.
objective: Win by restricting the enemy king and improving your position.

title: Rook + g-pawn vs King
description: Rook and pawn vs lone king. Use the rook to shield the pawn's advance.
objective: Promote the g-pawn with rook support.

title: Vancura Position
description: A key rook endgame drawing technique with rook pawn. The defending rook harasses from the side.
objective: Understand the Vancura drawing mechanism with the a/h-pawn.

title: Rook vs Pawn with Promotion Threat
description: Black's rook tries to stop the b-pawn. Can White promote?
objective: Promote the b-pawn despite Black's rook defense.

title: R+P vs R: King Support
description: White has R+P but needs good king placement. Advance the pawn with king escort.
objective: Win by coordinating rook and king to push the e-pawn.

title: Lucena Bridge Building
description: Classic bridge-building technique. The rook shields the king from checks.
objective: Win with the bridge technique — interpose the rook to block checks.

title: Queen vs King — Basic Checkmate
description: Queen and king vs lone king. Practice the systematic checkmate technique.
objective: Checkmate with queen and king. Drive the king to the edge.

title: Queen vs a-pawn on 7th
description: Queen vs rook pawn on the 7th. This is a draw because of stalemate tricks.
objective: Try to win. Discover why this position is a draw.

title: Queen vs c-pawn on 7th
description: Queen vs non-rook pawn on the 7th rank. White can win with precise technique.
objective: Win by using queen checks to bring the king closer while preventing promotion.

title: Queen vs b-pawn on 7th
description: Queen vs b-pawn. Can White avoid stalemate and win?
objective: Win the pawn using queen checks to bring the king closer.

title: Queen Checkmate Technique
description: Queen + King vs King. Drive the enemy to the edge with systematic queen moves.
objective: Deliver checkmate using queen and king coordination.

title: Queen vs Pawn: Winning Method
description: Standard technique: use queen to block promotion and bring king closer.
objective: Win the pawn by using the queen to control the promotion square.

title: Bishop & King vs King — Insufficient
description: Bishop and king cannot force checkmate against a lone king. This is a draw.
objective: Recognize that this position is a theoretical draw — insufficient material.

title: Bishop + Pawn vs King: Normal Win
description: Bishop and pawn vs lone king. Win by advancing the pawn with piece support.
objective: Promote the d-pawn with bishop and king support.

title: Wrong Bishop + Rook Pawn
description: The bishop doesn't control the promotion square. This is a famous drawn position.
objective: This is a draw. The bishop cannot control h8 (wrong color).

title: Right Bishop + Pawn Win
description: The bishop controls the promotion square. This is a straightforward win.
objective: Promote the g-pawn. The bishop covers the key square.

title: Opposite Bishops + Pawn
description: Opposite-colored bishops with one pawn. A notorious drawing tendency in endgames.
objective: Try to promote. Opposite bishops make this very difficult to win.

title: Bishop Fortress
description: Black has a fortress with f7 pawn. Can White break through?
objective: Attempt to win. Discover if Black's fortress holds.

title: Knight + Pawn vs King
description: Knight and pawn vs lone king. Knight helps escort the pawn to promotion.
objective: Promote the e-pawn using the knight to control key squares.

title: Knight + Pawn Coordination
description: Use the knight to protect key squares while advancing the pawn.
objective: Advance and promote the e-pawn with knight and king support.

title: Knight & King vs King — Insufficient
description: Knight and king cannot force checkmate. This is always a draw.
objective: Recognize insufficient material — K+N vs K is always a draw.

title: Knight Supports c-pawn
description: The knight supports the passed c-pawn while the king restricts the enemy king.
objective: Promote the c-pawn with correct knight maneuvers.

title: Knight Stalemate Trap
description: Knight can accidentally cause stalemate. Be careful with the mating net.
objective: Avoid stalemate while restricting the enemy king.

title: Knight + d-pawn on 6th
description: Advanced pawn on the 6th with knight support. Win by promoting.
objective: Force promotion of the d-pawn using the knight.

title: Pawn Breakthrough
description: Classic pawn breakthrough. One of the pawns will break through to promote.
objective: Find the pawn breakthrough combination to create a passed pawn.

title: Zugzwang in Pawn Ending
description: A mutual zugzwang position. The side to move loses!
objective: Understand zugzwang — whoever moves is in trouble.

title: Pawn Race — Counting Tempi
description: Both sides race to promote. Count the tempi to see who queens first.
objective: Win the pawn race by promoting first or with a tempo advantage.

title: Symmetrical Pawns — Opposition Wins
description: Symmetrical pawn structure. The side with opposition wins the enemy pawn.
objective: Win by using opposition to outflank and capture Black's pawn.

title: Outside Passed Pawn
description: The outside passed pawn is a powerful weapon — it decoys the enemy king.
objective: Win using the outside passed pawn to decoy Black's king.

title: Racing Passed Pawns
description: Both sides have a passed pawn racing to promote. Who wins the race?
objective: Promote the b-pawn or stop Black's a-pawn. Calculate the race.

title: Fixed Pawn Structure — Outflanking
description: Locked pawns. The only winning plan is to outflank via the wing.
objective: Win by marching the king around the locked pawns to outflank.

title: Complex Pawn Break
description: A complex pawn structure. Find the breakthrough to create a winning passed pawn.
objective: Find the correct pawn break to win material or promote.

title: Pawn Majority Wins
description: White has a 2 vs 2 pawn majority on the kingside but better placed pawns.
objective: Create a passed pawn using the pawn majority and promote.

title: Opposition with b-pawns
description: Both sides have a b-pawn. Opposition determines the outcome.
objective: Win or draw by correctly using opposition.

title: Distant Passed Pawn
description: White's h-pawn becomes a decoy to lure the Black king away.
objective: Win by advancing the h-pawn to distract, then capture on the queenside.

title: Rook vs Knight + Pawns
description: Rook versus knight with pawns on the board. Rook's long-range power matters.
objective: Use the rook's superiority over the knight in open positions.

title: Knight vs Pawn — Blockade
description: The knight blockades the passed pawn while the king approaches.
objective: Win by blockading the pawn with the knight and using the king.

title: Bishop vs Pawns: Good Bishop
description: Bishop is strong when pawns are on both sides of the board.
objective: Exploit the bishop's long-range to win pawns or promote.

title: Knight + Pawn vs King + Pawn
description: Knight and fixed pawns. Knight must outmaneuver to create a winning advantage.
objective: Win by using the knight to outflank while pawns are fixed.

title: Knight Outpost
description: Knight on a dominant central square restricts the enemy king.
objective: Win using the knight's dominance from d5 to push pawns.

title: Pawn vs Bishop — Can the Pawn Promote?
description: The passed d-pawn races to promote. Can the bishop stop it?
objective: Advance the d-pawn. Determine if it can outrun the bishop.

title: Reti Study
description: The legendary Reti study (1921). White's king simultaneously chases and supports.
objective: Draw by chasing Black's h-pawn AND supporting your c-pawn simultaneously.

title: Two Knights Checkmate
description: Two knights cannot force checkmate against a lone king, but with a pawn it's different.
objective: Win using two knights — the pawn prevents stalemate.

title: Rook + Passed Pawn vs Rook
description: White's c-pawn is advanced. Can it promote with rook support?
objective: Promote the c-pawn using the rook to shield from checks.
